post_text: The deadline to apply for P-EBT food benefits has been extended to July 31. Eligible families can apply for this one-time food benefit. Children who received free or reduced-price school meals through the National School Lunch Program during the 2019-2020 school year are eligible for P-EBT. Eligible families should have received the application link from their school. Eligible families that received SNAP benefits for March have already received P-EBT benefits and do not have to apply. If you did not receive an application link or if you need help filling out the P-EBT application, please contact the P-EBT Call Center at 833-613-6220. The public charge rule does not apply to P-EBT benefits.

post_text:
Dear Parents,

The Child Nutrition Department follows all guidelines through Texas Department of Agriculture and U.S.Department of Agriculture; currently, we are pending a waiver to allow parents to pick-up meals without their children present. USDA approved a waiver for parents to pick-up meals without their children "once they review and approve the Texas Department of Agriculture's method in place." TDA has submitted the plan/method and is pending approval from USDA. Once we receive an update from TDA to include the process of how we will handle distributing meals to parents without their children present, we will update you.

This is an excerpt of the waiver from USDA:
However, State agencies must have a plan for ensuring that Program operators are able to maintain accountability and program integrity. This includes putting in place processes to ensure that meals are distributed only to parents or guardians of eligible children.

Sincerely,
Olga Perez
Child Nutrition Director

No spring break plans? No problem - Right At School has you covered! We are offering full-day camps all week long during spring break, March 9th to March 13th. Drop off is anytime from 6:30am to 10am and pick-up is at 6:30pm. The camp will be offered at Potranco Elementary, located at 190 County Rd 381, San Antonio, TX 78253.

This spring break, we’re living out our Hollywood dream with our curriculum theme: Lights! Camera! Action Stars! Campers will become actors, directors, writers and much more as we explore the fascinating world of film.

Fees are $19/day for each child. Children MUST be enrolled prior to the day of camp.

Simply follow this link to register: https://mvisd.co/386COHx Please note that you will register on Potranco’s page. Please register by March 2nd, to save your place.

Please let us know if you have any questions. We look forward to a week of oozy awesomeness!



Traci Punty, Area Manager

Congratulations to our Leaders of the Week- Ali Vocke and Caden Coombs!!

Ali Vocke is a 4th Grade student who is a quiet, but POWERFUL Leader. She doesn't boast or brag about herself. She is humble and kind and could easily get overlooked for how Great she truly is. She volunteers to help where help is needed. She comes in each morning to get the Fine Arts classroom ready. She makes sure everything is put in its right place. She does this because she loves to help others. She doesn't do stuff for the glory and accolades - she does it because she has a true servants heart. Serving others in need brings a sweet smile to her face showing that she truly enjoys her quiet role as a Leader at LCE!

Caden Coombs embodies what a leader should be. He is responsible and smart with the choices he makes. He reflects about how others feel and is kind at every turn. I strive to be like Caden Coombs.

Thank you to our PTO for donating these awesome shirts that our leaders will proudly wear!

MVISD needs your help to name Elementary No. 5!

At the School Board meeting on Monday, October 21, 2019, the MVISD Board of trustees announced their intention to solicit names for Elementary No. 5.

The new elementary will be located in the Ladera subdivision located off HWY 211 and is expected to be completed in time for the 2021-2022 school year.

School board policy states that “Consideration shall be given to naming elementary schools after the area, road, or subdivision in which they are located. Elementary schools shall not be named for individuals.”

MVISD students, staff and community members may submit an entry and should use the form provided on the district website www.mvisd.com. Submissions will be accepted through December 2, 2019. Completed forms can be submitted to MVISD Central Administration. https://mvisd.co/3625eCx

post_text: Congratulations to LaCoste Elementary School for being the first recipient to win the Title I Traveling Trophy! LaCoste has earned bragging rights accompanied by a beautiful traveling trophy for the month of September. The staff members were the first to complete the required "Parents Involved in Every School" training within the first couple of weeks of the assignment! Way to go! The Title-I Traveling Trophy has been implemented this year for the first time to promote and encourage friendly competition between our Title I campuses. At the moment, the four MVISD elementary campuses are school-wide Title -I campuses. Not only will this promote friendly competition but it helps communicate the various areas that promote building capacity with our parents and families. The competition will continue throughout the year with a different challenge every month. LaCoste Elementary School's secretary, Kayla Patton said: "This trophy is staying here!" The competition is going to be undoubtedly interesting to watch as each campus is working on being the next to take the trophy.
